remarks: There is a unique line going through any two distinct points.  Theorem 6.19 of [Schwabhauser] p. 46.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 29-Oct-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
statement:
linethrueu $p |- ( ( N e. NN /\ ( P e. ( EE ` N ) /\ Q e. ( EE ` N ) /\ P =/= Q ) ) -> E! x e. LinesEE ( P e. x /\ Q e. x ) ) $.
$d P x $.
$d Q x $.
